text:
1. **PERSONAL INFORMATION**

   - First year did you start housekeeping in eastern Canada?
   - Where did you get your housekeeping?
   - How far was it to your nearest store?
   - How far was it to your nearest town?
   - How far was it to your nearest city?
   - How far was it to your nearest railway station?

2. **FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS**

   - What brand of white flour did you use in Eastern Canada?
   - In what quantities did you buy?
   - What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour?
   - How much did you use?
   - Was flour milled locally?
   - What was the price for a twenty pound bag of flour?
   - What other grain products did you use?
   - Cornmeal?
   - Oats?
   - Did you grind your own wheat for porridge?
   - How did you grind it?

3. **GROCERIES AND STAPLES**

In what quantity did you buy flour to make?  
That was the price for a ton of flour at that time?  
What brand of flour did you usually buy?  
At what price?

4. **DAIRY PRODUCTS**

How did you get milk in the early days?  
Did you have cows or goats?  
Did you keep cows for milk?  
Did you make butter?  
What kind of cheese?

5. **MEAT AND FISH**

What was your meat supply in the early years?  
How often did you eat fresh meat?  
For did you preserve meat?  
Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood?  
If so what year was it organized?  
Did you use (name)?  
What part did fish play in the family diet?  
Was the fish fresh, canned, or smoked?

6. **FRESH FRUIT**

Did you grow your own fruit?  
Did you buy fruit from neighbors?  
Did you buy fruit from stores?  
Did you preserve fruit?  
Was there a "fruit ring" in your neighborhood?  
If so what year was it organized?  
Did you use (name)?  
What part did fruit play in the family diet?  
Was the fruit fresh, canned, or smoked?

7. **VEGETABLES**

Did you grow your own vegetables?  
Did you buy vegetables from neighbors?  
Did you buy vegetables from stores?  
Did you preserve vegetables?  
Was there a "vegetable ring" in your neighborhood?  
If so what year was it organized?  
Did you use (name)?  
What part did vegetables play in the family diet?  
Was the vegetables fresh, canned, or smoked?
3. Shopping and Storage

In what quantity did you buy dairy products? 10 lb.

What was the price for a ton of sugar? $2.50 - $4.00.

What brand of golden corn syrup did you use? Butter.

What size of tin of syrup did you usually buy? 10 lbs.

At what price? $1.00.

4. Daily Purchases

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days? Purchased.

That was the price of butter? $1.50 - $2.00.

Did you keep eggs for future use? Yes.

Did you make butter? Yes.

What kind of cheese?

5. Meat and Fish

What was your meat usually in the early days? Pork.

How did you get fresh meat? Bought it from Amos Steele.

How often did you get fresh meat? Every 2 weeks.

Did you preserve meat? No.

My husband used to make sausages.

Was there a "meat ring" in your neighborhood? Not sure.

If so what was it originally? Not sure.

Did you use meat? Yes.

Did you use canned meat? Yes.

For how long? Not sure.

Did you add meat to the family diet? Yes.

Was the dish fresh, cooked or canned? Canned.

Was the dish served hot or cold? Hot.

Was the dish eaten in summer? Yes.

Purchased.

12. WATER SUPPLY

There did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (well, river, cistern, dugout) ...

If so, how was this water from your house? ...

How was it brought to the house? (pail, barrel, tank) ...

Any arising water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started homesteading, giving dates where possible.
13. **SPARES**

   - Did you buy any spare parts for your stove?
     - Yes
     - No

   - If yes, what were they?
     - Stove pipe
     - Other

   - If no, why not?

14. **FUEL**

   - What fuel did you use in the earliest days?
     - Wood
     - Coal
     - Other

   - Share how you used your fuel:
     - Open fireplaces
     - Stoves
     - Other

   - Did you ever use any other fuels?
     - Yes
     - No

     - Gas
     - Oil
     - Other

     - Wood stove
     - Oil stove
     - Other

     - Radiator

15. **COOKING APPLIANCES**

   - For cooking, did you use an indoor fireplace or open hearth in the earliest days?
     - Yes
     - No

   - Did you use an outdoor fireplace or bake oven?
     - Yes
     - No

   - By whom was your first cook stove made?
     - Purchased
     - Other

   - What year was it purchased?
     - 1905
     - Other

   - For grilling food, did you use an outdoor grill?
     - Yes
     - No

   - Did you ever use any other cooking methods?
     - Yes
     - No

   - If yes, what were they?
     - Electric range
     - Other

   - How long have you been using this method?
     - Less than 10 years
     - 10-20 years
     - Over 20 years
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earlier days as compared with today.

We now do not use as much home bread as we did in the earlier days. We use more of the purchased variety instead of home prepared breakfast foods. Also we don't use as much bread, flour, milk, not even a half and one fourth.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of home made and more natural foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible.)

The change came gradually over a long period. We used to can mostly in open pans. Later by freezing in waxed rolls and now quilt a few use pressure cookers.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and storing foods in your early pioneer days in eastern North Dakota. Include dates not mentioned above, quality, methods of purchasing, prices, purchases of stores, churches and other institutions. (Use back of page if more space is needed.)
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the past year.

We now do not use as much home cooking as we did in the earlier days. We use more of the purchased foods instead of home cooked breakfast foods. Also we don't use as much bread, jams, etc., not even on hot and cold cereal.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of home made and home grown foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible.)

The change came gradually over a long period. We used to can mostly in glass jars but by purchasing in waxed jars and new fruits a few we purchase canned.
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homestead and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. [Use back of page if more space is needed].
20. Identify any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homegrown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).
